problem.p: The forces acting on the cart are shown in the free body diagram below:
Because the cart is at rest the net force on the cart is zero, then Netwon’s second law on the cart implies that along the x-axis:
Fspring - mgsin\(\theta\) = 0 (eq.1)

Because the spring is stretched a distance l - lo from its natural length lo, then the force of the spring on the cart has a magnitude of Fspring = k(l − lo) . Replacing this expression in (eq. 1) we obtain that:
l = lo + \({mgsin\theta\over k}\)

Process: The process to consider is the cart moving down and then up of the ramp. It starts at the instant right after the cart is released from rest and the spring is compressed a distance x1 with respect to its equilibrium position. It ends at the instant right when the spring first returns to its natural length of lo after being stretched a distance x2.
\(\ast\)\(\ast\) The conservative work done by the internal forces is represented as a potential energy.

Because the internal forces are conservative and the work done by the external forces is zero, then the mechanical energy of the cart+Earth+system is constant during the time interval under consideration.
Let's define the zero of potential energy to be the position of the free end of the spring when its length is the natural length of lo.
Initial state:
Cart:
It is at rest, vi = 0, Ki = 0.
It is at a height hi - xi sin\(\theta\)(see figure), then Uigravity = mghi = mgx1sin\(\theta\)
Spring:
It is compressed a distance x1 from its natural length lo : Uispring = \({1\over 2}\) k x12
Initial Mechanicial Energy:
Ei = mghi + \({1\over 2}\) k x12 = mgx1sin\(\theta\) + \({1\over 2}\) kx12
Final state:
Cart:
It is moving with vf Kf = \({1\over 2}\) kmvf2
It is at a height hf = 0 , the Ufgravity = 0
Spring: The length of the spring is lo , the Ufspring = 0
Final Mechanicial Energy:
Ef = \({1\over 2}\) mvf2
Ef = Ei \(\Rightarrow\) vf = \(\sqrt{2gx_{1}sin\theta}\) + \({k\over m}\)x12
(Check: if \(\theta\) = 0 then the problem reduces to the horizontal oscillating spring done in class.)
For the same system and same process we need to consider the external force of friction which is doing work on the system and given by
\(\displaystyle W_{i,f}^{friction} =\int_{h_{i}}^{h_{f}} \! \vec{F}_{friction} \, \mathrm{d} \vec{l} = - \mu_{k} mgcos\theta x_{1}\)
Applying the work energy principle:
Ef = Ei + Wi,ffriction \(\Rightarrow\) \({1\over 2}\) mvf2 = mghi + \({1\over 2}\) kx12 - \({\mu_{k}mg\over cos\theta}\)x1
And the velocity at the unstretched length is
vf = \(\sqrt{2gx_{1}sin\theta}\) + \({k\over m}\)x12 - \({2\mu_{k}g\over cos\theta x_{1}}\)
